channel.title: CyberNetSec - Data Breach
channel.description: Latest data breach threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: "Shadow Escape": New Zero-Click Attack Steals Data from ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini
item.description:
A novel zero-click attack vector named "Shadow Escape" has been discovered by researchers at Operant, capable of silently exfiltrating sensitive data from popular AI agents like OpenAI's ChatGPT, Anthropic's Claude, and Google's Gemini. The attack exploits the Model Context Protocol (MCP) by embeddi...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Cloud Security, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Massive 70TB Data Leak at Tata Motors from Exposed AWS Keys
item.description:
A colossal security failure at Tata Motors has resulted in the exposure of over 70 terabytes of sensitive corporate data, customer information, and infrastructure details. The breach, which was first identified in 2023, stemmed from multiple critical misconfigurations, including plaintext Amazon Web...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Hits Swedish Power Grid Operator, Steals 280GB of Data
item.description:
Sweden's national electricity operator, Svenska kraftnät, has confirmed a data breach following a claim by the Everest ransomware group. The attackers alleged on their dark web leak site that they had stolen 280 GB of internal data. Svenska kraftnät stated that the attack was confined to an external...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Massive Breach at Kenyan Health Platform M-TIBA Exposes 4.8 Million Patients
item.description:
A threat actor named 'Kazu' has claimed responsibility for a catastrophic data breach against M-TIBA, a major mobile health platform in Kenya backed by Safaricom. The hacker alleges the theft of 2.15 terabytes of data, impacting up to 4.8 million users. The compromised information reportedly include...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical Adobe Commerce Flaw Under Active Exploitation, CISA Warns
item.description:
A critical improper input validation vulnerability in Adobe Commerce and Magento, tracked as CVE-2025-54236, is being actively exploited in the wild. Dubbed 'SessionReaper,' the flaw allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to hijack user sessions via the REST API, leading to potential web shell de...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Data Breaches Hit Toys 'R' Us Canada, Askul, and Verisure
item.description:
A wave of data breaches has impacted several consumer-facing companies globally. Toys "R" Us Canada has had customer records leaked on the dark web. Japanese retailer Askul suffered a disruptive ransomware attack that halted operations and may have resulted in a data leak. Additionally, Swedish secu...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware

item.title: Healthcare Sector Rocked by Breaches at ModMed, LifeBridge, and Right at Home
item.description:
The healthcare sector continues to be a prime target for cyberattacks, with recent data breaches announced by Electronic Health Record (EHR) provider Modernizing Medicine (ModMed), home healthcare provider Right at Home, and Baltimore-based LifeBridge Health. The incidents, which include a ransomwar...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Regulatory

item.title: Tengu Ransomware Hits Brazilian Education Provider
item.description:
The Tengu ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against UniCursos, a prominent education provider in Brazil. The attack, which was posted to the group's leak site on October 23, 2025, follows the common double-extortion model, where the attackers threaten to publish sensitive...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

item.title: Ransomware Hits Jewett-Cameron, Steals Financial Data
item.description:
Jewett-Cameron, an Oregon-based manufacturing and distribution company, has confirmed in an SEC filing that it suffered a ransomware attack on October 15, 2025. The attack caused significant disruption to its business operations and resulted in the theft of sensitive corporate data. The exfiltrated ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

item.title: Lawsuit Hits SC School District After Ransomware Breach
item.description:
South Carolina's Lexington-Richland School District 5 (LR5) is facing a class-action lawsuit following a ransomware attack in June 2025 that exposed the personally identifiable information (PII) of over 31,000 students, staff, and alumni. The lawsuit alleges that the school district was negligent in...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Regulatory
